etymology.description: 保(保) (bǎo, "protect") provides the phonetic element + 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") as the semantic element = a structure related to earth or protection -> fort; castle
etymology.interpretation: The character 堡(bǎo) combines the idea of protection from 保(保) (bǎo, "protect") with 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") to convey a fortified structure made of earth, such as a fort or castle.

examples.chinese: 这座堡曾经防御入侵(這座堡曾經防禦入侵)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò bǎo céngjīng fángyù rùqīn.
examples.english: This fort once defended against invasions.

examples.chinese: 那座堡矗立在山顶(那座堡矗立在山頂)，守护着国家的安全(守護著國家的安全)。
examples.pinyin: Nà zuò bǎo chùlì zài shāndǐng, shǒuhù zhe guójiā de ānquán.
examples.english: That fort stands on the mountain top, guarding the nation's safety.
